meanings.definition: A mill for grinding grain, especially for producing flour.
meanings.sent1: The old gristmills in the town were used to make flour from wheat.
meanings.sent2: The farmer took his wheat to the gristmills to have it ground into flour.
meanings.sent3: The gristmills were so busy that the wheat grains had to wait in line for their turn to be ground.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a gristmill, constantly grinding through ideas to produce creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gristmills turning echoed through the valley, a rhythmic reminder of the town's industry.

meanings.definition: The grain or quantity of grain to be ground at one time.
meanings.sent1: The farmer brought a large sack of wheat as gristmills for the miller to grind.
meanings.sent2: The gristmills were overflowing with grain, ready to be turned into flour.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played a prank by filling the gristmills with corn kernels instead of wheat.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like gristmills, processing each idea one grain at a time.
meanings.sent5: The gristmills were so full of grain that they seemed to groan under the weight, ready to start their work.
